Title:
Evolution of multipartite mitochondrial genomes in the
booklice of the genus Liposcelis (Psocoptera)
Keywords:
Mitochondrial genome; Liposcelis entomophila; Liposcelis
paeta; Pseudogene; Evolution
Abstract:
Background: The genus Liposcelis (Psocoptera:
Troctomorpha) has more than 120 species with a worldwide distribution
and they pose a risk for global food security. The organization of
mitochondrial (mt) genomes varies between the two species of booklice
investigated in the genus Liposcelis. Liposcelis decolor has its mt
genes on a single chromosome, like most other insects; L.
bostrychophila, however, has a multipartite mt genome with genes on two
chromosomes.
